articles.title: Making a Podcast Recording on a Short Deadline
articles.sub_title: Review of all the hardware, software, and physical space set up you need to create the best podcast with as little headache as possible

paragraphs: Preparing to create a podcast on a short deadline can seem like an overwhelming task. Thought has to go into which type of microphone should be used. Where can a recording be done without distracting interruptions or background noise, and if the podcast involves multiple participants, how should the audio recording be set up to capture all voices at a high level of quality.
These questions may seem overwhelming, but the first step recommended is actually to step back and do some reflection and planning.

Once some simple questions are answers, it's possible to move things forward quickly. The questions include, what is the topic of the podcast? Does it involve prior research? Will the participants have a discussion.
Additionally, there are some technical questions that should be asked. How quickly does the podcast need to be produced? Will the podcast need considerable editing before it can be used?
Finally, how will the podcast be distributed? Will it be uploaded to popular podcast distribution services like Apple Podcasts or Spotify? And is there prepared metadata for the podcast publication?
All these planning steps, done with thought and deliberation prior to the actual production of the podcast, will make life much easier and help to anticipate issues before the arise.

Creating a podcast requires several tools: one or more microphones, XLR cables to connect microphones to an audio interface, which is then connected to a computer; software is needed to edit, mix, and optimize the audio recording; finally, a podcast streaming service is used to upload and distribute the finished podcast.
Each of these components needs to be in place to make the podcast successful. Knowledge and expertise using each is also a big plus and will make the entire workflow much more enjoyable.

An important tip to making podcasts is to create content, but don't dwell on it for too long. It's important that content creation happens at regular intervals and improvements will come with time and experience.
After getting a few podcasts under your belt, the process will begin to speed up and errors that seemed big in the beginning will be easier to address and avoid as you produce more and more content.
